creator: ytp@vc-net.ne.jp
text:
Hi!
We could not get correct Japanese response from servlet
since org.apache.coyote.Response#setLocale() method does not
set "charset" of encoding.
Japanese words are displayed as, "?????".
I think it must determine the encoding character for the locale
by using CharsetMapper.

Regards.

Yoshi TANAKA

I supplement about this bug.

Although it was thought that this bug had already been solved by Bug 6569,
it has occurred again under Tomcat 4.1.x .

For example,
unless that bug is solved, it is influenced with i18n tag's execution of JSTL.
creator: super-creek@jcom.home.ne.jp

text:
Created attachment 3013
This is the patch which fixes this bug of the Coyote HTTP/1.1 Connector for Tomcat 4.x .
creator: super-creek@jcom.home.ne.jp

text:
This bug occurs in the latest distribution of Tomcat 4.1 invariably.
So, I strongly hope that the patch will be applied before Tomcat 4.1's next 
release.

Regards,
OGAWA Kan
